variable.name: SUBJID
variable.description: WHI dbGaP Subject ID

variable.name: F155DAYS
variable.description: F155 Days since randomization or enrollment

variable.name: F155VTYP
variable.description: Visit type

variable.name: F155VY
variable.description: Visit year
variable.comment: Visit year for which this form was collected.

variable.name: GENHEL
variable.description: In general, your health is
variable.comment: In general, would you say your health is:

variable.name: HLTHC1Y
variable.description: Compare health to 1 year ago
variable.comment: Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?

variable.name: LIFEQUAL
variable.description: Rate quality of life
variable.comment: Overall, how would you rate your quality of life? (Mark one circle below.)

variable.name: HEARING
variable.description: How would you describe your hearing
variable.comment: How would you describe your hearing?

variable.name: MOUTHTEETH
variable.description: How would you describe the condition of your mouth and teeth
variable.comment: How would you describe the condition of your mouth and teeth?

variable.name: VISION
variable.description: How would you describe your vision
variable.comment: How would you describe your vision (corrected with glasses or lenses as needed)?

variable.name: APPETITE
variable.description: How would you describe your appetite
variable.comment: How would you describe your appetite?

variable.name: BALANCE
variable.description: How would you describe your balance
variable.comment: How would you describe your balance?

variable.name: CALCIUM
variable.description: Taking calcium supplement
variable.comment: Are you taking a calcium supplement such as Oscal, Viactiv, or Tums?

variable.name: HRPST1YR
variable.description: Used female hormones in past year
variable.comment: In the past year, did you use any of the following female hormones - ESTROGEN, PROGESTERONE (also called PROGESTIN), or TESTOSTERONE - that were prescribed by a doctor? (This may have been in the form of a pill; skin patch; shot; cream; vaginal ring, pellet, or suppository; or bioidentical compound.)

variable.name: LOST10LB1Y
variable.description: Lost 10+ lbs past year
variable.comment: Have you lost 10 pounds or more in the past year?

variable.name: SMOKNOW
variable.description: Smoke cigarettes now
variable.comment: Do you smoke cigarettes now?

variable.name: CIGSDAY
variable.description: Cigarettes per day
variable.comment: How many cigarettes do you usually smoke each day? Sub-question of F155 V1 Q8 'Smoke cigarettes now'.

variable.name: ALCOFTEN
variable.description: Alcohol past 3 months, how often
variable.comment: In the past 3 months, how often have you had drinks containing alcohol?

variable.name: VIGACT
variable.description: Health limits vigorous activities
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, or strenuous sports

variable.name: MODACT
variable.description: Health limits moderate activities
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Moderate activities, such as moving a table, vacuuming, bowling, or golfing

variable.name: LIFTGROC
variable.description: Health limits lifting or carrying groceries
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Lifting or carrying groceries

variable.name: STAIRS
variable.description: Health limits climbing several flights of stairs
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Climbing several flights of stairs

variable.name: STAIR
variable.description: Health limits climbing one flight of stairs
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Climbing one flight of stairs

variable.name: BENDING
variable.description: Health limits bending, kneeling, stooping
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line) Bending, kneeling, stooping

variable.name: WALK1M
variable.description: Health limits walking more than a mile
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Walking more than a mile

variable.name: WALKBLKS
variable.description: Health limits walking several blocks
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Walking several blocks

variable.name: WALK1BLK
variable.description: Health limits walking one block
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Walking one block

variable.name: BATHING
variable.description: Health limits bathing or dressing yourself
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle on each line.) Bathing or dressing yourself

variable.name: WALK
variable.description: Times walk for > 10 min
variable.comment: Think about the walking you do outside the home. How often do you walk outside the home for more than 10 minutes without stopping? (Mark only one.)

variable.name: WALKMIN
variable.description: Duration of walks when >10 min
variable.comment: When you walk outside the home for more than 10 minutes without stopping, for how many minutes do you usually walk? Sub-question of F155 V1 Q20 ' Times walk for > 10 min' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: WALKSPD
variable.description: Walking speed when walking for >10 min
variable.comment: When you walk outside the home for more than 10 minutes without stopping, what is your usual speed? Sub-question of F155 V1 Q20 ' Times walk for > 10 min' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: MDSTEXFREQ
variable.description: How often each week do moderate or strenuous exercise
variable.comment: Not counting walking outside the home, how often each week (7 days) do you usually do MODERATE OR STRENUOS EXERCISE. For example, biking outdoors, use of an exercise machine (like a stationary bike or treadmill), aerobics, swimming, folk or popular dancing, jogging, tennis.

variable.name: MDSTEXMIN
variable.description: Duration per time of moderate or strenuous exercise
variable.comment: How long do you usually exercise like this at one time? MODERATE OR STRENUOUS EXERCISE. For example, biking outdoors, using an exercise machine (like a stationary bike or treadmill), aerobics, swimming, folk or popular dancing, jogging, tennis. Sub-question of F155 V1 Q21.1 'How often each week do moderate or strenuous exercise'

variable.name: MLDEX
variable.description: How often each week do mild exercise
variable.comment: Not counting walking outside the home, how often each week (7 days) do you usually do the exercises below? MILD EXERCISE. For example, slow dancing, bowling, or golf.

variable.name: MLDEXMIN
variable.description: Duration per time of mild exercise
variable.comment: How long do you usually exercise like this at one time? MILD EXERCISE. For example, slow dancing, bowling, or golf. Sub-question of F155 V1 Q21.3 'How often each week do mild exercise'

variable.name: FEEDSELF
variable.description: Can you feed yourself
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each line.) Can you feed yourself?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: DRESS
variable.description: Can you dress and undress yourself
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each line.) Can you dress and undress yourself?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: INOUTBED
variable.description: Can you get in and out of bed yourself
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each line.) Can you get in and out of bed yourself?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: SHOWER
variable.description: Can you take a bath or shower
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each line.) Can you take a bath or shower?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: GROCSHOP
variable.description: Can you do your own grocery shopping
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each line.) Can you do your own grocery shopping?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: TAKEMEDS
variable.description: Can you keep track of and take your medicines
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each line.) Can you keep track of and take your medicines?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: WALKAID
variable.description: Aid to walk on a level surface
variable.comment: What aid, if any, do you usually use to walk on a level surface? (Mark one.)
variable.value: I do not use any aid

variable.name: LIVALN
variable.description: Do you live alone

variable.name: LIVPRT
variable.description: Live with husband or partner
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark all that apply.) I live with my husband or partner Sub-question of F155 V1 Q29 'Do you live alone' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: LIVCHLD
variable.description: Live with children
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark all that apply.) I live with my children Sub-question of F155 V1 Q29 'Do you live alone' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: LIVREL
variable.description: Live with other relatives
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark all that apply.) I live with my other relatives Sub-question of F155 V1 Q29 'Do you live alone' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: LIVFRNDS
variable.description: Live with friends
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark all that apply.) I live with friends Sub-question of F155 V1 Q29 'Do you live alone' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: LIVOTH
variable.description: Live with other than listed
variable.comment: Who lives with you? (Mark all that apply.) Other Sub-question of F155 V1 Q29 'Do you live alone' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: SPECSERV
variable.description: Special services where living
variable.comment: Does the place where you live have special services for older people (such as help with meals, medicines, bathing, or transportation)?

variable.name: RECVSERV
variable.description: Receiving special services where living
variable.comment: Are you currently receving any of these services? Sub-question of F155 V1 Q30 'Special services where living' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: NURSHOME
variable.description: In past year, stayed in a nursing home
variable.comment: In the past year, have you stayed in a nursing home?

variable.name: EATOUT
variable.description: Frequency eat out of the house
variable.comment: Now some questions about your social activities. How often, if at all, do you do any of the following activities? (Mark one circle on each line.) Eat out of the house

variable.name: SHOP
variable.description: Frequency go shopping
variable.comment: Now some questions about your social activities. How often, if at all, do you do any of the following activities? (Mark one circle on each line.) Go Shopping

variable.name: CULTURALEVT
variable.description: Frequency go to a cultural event
variable.comment: Now some questions about your social activities. How often, if at all, do you do any of the following activities? (Mark one circle on each line.) Go to a cultural event such as a movie, concert, play, or lecture

variable.name: MEETFAMILY
variable.description: Frequency meet with family or friends
variable.comment: Now some questions about your social activities. How often, if at all, do you do any of the following activities? (Mark one circle on each line.) Meet with family or friends who do not live with you

variable.name: PHONEEMAIL
variable.description: Frequency communicate with family or friends by phone or email
variable.comment: Now some questions about your social activities. How often, if at all, do you do any of the following activities? (Mark one circle on each line.) Communicate with family or friends by phone or email

variable.name: CHURCH
variable.description: Frequency go to church or other religious center
variable.comment: Now some questions about your social activities. How often, if at all, do you do any of the following activities? (Mark one circle on each line.) Go to church or other religious center

variable.name: LISTEN
variable.description: Someone to listen when need to talk
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone you can count on to listen to you when you need to talk

variable.name: GOODADVC
variable.description: Someone to give you good advice
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to give you good advice about a problem

variable.name: TAKEDR
variable.description: Someone to take you to the doctor
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to take you to the doctor if you need it

variable.name: GOODTIME
variable.description: Someone to have a good time with
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to have a good time with

variable.name: HLPPROB
variable.description: Someone to help you understand a problem
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to help you understand a problem when you need it

variable.name: HLPCHORS
variable.description: Someone to help with daily chores
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to help with daily chores if you are sick

variable.name: SHARE
variable.description: Someone to share private worries and fears
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to share your most private worries and fears

variable.name: FUN
variable.description: Someone to do something fun with
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to do something fun with

variable.name: LOVE
variable.description: Someone to love you and make you feel wanted
variable.comment: People sometimes look to to others for help, friendship, or other types of support. Next are some questions about the support that you have. How often is each of the following kinds of support available to you if you need it? (Mark one circle on each line.) Someone to love you and make you feel wanted

variable.name: NEGLECT
variable.description: Felt people neglected care needs
variable.comment: When growing older, we may rely on others more to help us with everyday care (meals or bathing or transportation, etc.). How often in the past 4 weeks have you felt that people you rely on for everyday care have neglected your needs?
variable.value: Does not apply. I don't need help with my everyday care
Almost no problems with obtaining everyday care
Occasional problems with obtaining everyday care
Frequent problems with obtaining everyday care

variable.name: SPOUSILL
variable.description: Did your spouse have a serious illness
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did your spouse or partner have a serious illness?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: FRIENDIE
variable.description: Did a close friend die
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did a close friend or family member die or have a serious illness (other than your spouse or partner)?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: MONPROB
variable.description: Major problems with money
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did you have any major problems with money?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did a family member or close friend have a divorce or break-up?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: MAJACC
variable.description: Major accident or disaster
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did you have any major accidents, disasters, mugging, unwanted sexual experiences, robberies, or similar events?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: FRNJOB
variable.description: You, family, friend lose job or retire
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did you or a family member or close friend lose their job or retire?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: PETDIE
variable.description: Did a pet die
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did a pet die?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: SPOUSDIE
variable.description: Did your spouse or partner die
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did your spouse or partner die?
variable.value: Yes, and it upset me: Not too much
Yes, and it upset me: Moderately
Yes, and it upset me: Very much

variable.name: SPOUSDIEYEARN
variable.description: I feel myself longing or yearning for my spouse or partner who died
variable.comment: If you anwered yes to 'Did your spouse or partner die (over the past year)', please mark the answer that best describes how you feel right now about the person who died: I feel myself longing or yearning for my spouse or partner who died -- I miss them so much it's hard to care about anything else. Sub-question of F155 V1 Q59 'Did your spouse or partner die'

variable.name: SPOUSDIETHINK
variable.description: I think about this person so much, it's hard for me to do things
variable.comment: If you anwered yes to 'Did your spouse or partner die (over the past year)', please mark the answer that best describes how you feel right now about the person who died: I think about this person so much that its hard for me to do the things I normally do. Sub-question of F155 V1 Q59 'Did your spouse or partner die'

variable.name: NIGHTSWT1Y
variable.description: How bothersome night sweats past year
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: Night sweats

variable.name: ACHES1Y
variable.description: How bothersome general aches or pains past year
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: General aches or pains

variable.name: BRSTTEN1Y
variable.description: How bothersome breast tenderness past year
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: Breast tenderness

variable.name: HOTFLASH1Y

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: Hot flashes

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: Mood swings

variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: Uncontrolled leaking of urine

variable.name: VAGDRY1Y
variable.description: How bothersome vaginal or genital dryness past year

variable.name: OTHSYMPTOM1Y
variable.description: How bothersome other (not listed) symptoms past year
variable.comment: Below is a list of symptoms women sometimes have as they become older or after menopause. For each item, mark the one circle that best describes how bothersome the symptom was over the past year. Be sure to mark one circle on each line: Other

variable.name: COLDHANDS
variable.description: How intensively suffer from cold hands or feet past 4 weeks
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how intensively did you suffer from the following: Cold hands or feet

variable.name: TOOWARM
variable.description: How intensively suffer from feeling too warm past 4 weeks
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how intensively did you suffer from the following: Feeling too warm

variable.name: PERSPIRE
variable.description: How intensively suffer from perspiring without exercise past 4 weeks
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how intensively did you suffer from the following: Perspiring (without exercise)

variable.name: GOOSEFLESH
variable.description: How intensively suffer from gooseflesh or shivering past 4 weeks
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how intensively did you suffer from the following: 'Gooseflesh' or shivering

variable.name: UNCOMFTEMP
variable.description: How intensively suffer from uncomfortableness with temperature past 4 weeks
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how intensively did you suffer from the following: Generally uncomfortable with the temperature

variable.name: NOCONTROL
variable.description: How often felt unable to control things in past 4 weeks
variable.comment: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you felt: That you were unable to control the important things in your life

variable.name: HANDLEPROB
variable.description: How often felt confident to handle your problems in past 4 weeks
variable.comment: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you felt: Confident about your ability to handle your personal problems

variable.name: GOINGURWAY
variable.description: How often felt things going your way past 4 weeks
variable.comment: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you felt: That things were going your way

variable.name: PILINGUP
variable.description: How often felt difficulties piling up in past 4 weeks
variable.comment: In the past 4 weeks, how often have you felt: That difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them

variable.name: BOUNCEBACK
variable.description: I tend to bounce back quickly after hard times
variable.comment: In general, I tend to bounce back quickly after hard times.

variable.name: STRESSRCVR
variable.description: Does not take me long to recover from stressful event
variable.comment: In general, it does not take me long to recover from a stressful event.

variable.name: STRESSHARD
variable.description: Have a hard time making it through stressful events
variable.comment: In general, I have a hard time making it through stressful events

variable.name: MEDSLEEP
variable.description: Did you take medication or alcohol to sleep
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you take any kind of medication or alcohol at bedtime to help you sleep?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: FALLSLP
variable.description: Fell asleep during quiet activities
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you fall asleep during quiet activities like reading, watching TV, or riding in a car?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: NAP
variable.description: Did you nap during the day
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you nap during the day?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: TRBSLEEP
variable.description: Did you have trouble falling asleep
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you have trouble falling asleep?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: WAKENIGHT
variable.description: Did you wake up several times
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you wake up serveral times at night?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: UPEARLY
variable.description: Did you wake up earlier than planned
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you wake up earlier than you planned to?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: BACKSLP
variable.description: Did you have trouble getting back to sleep
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits and experiences. Please pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you have trouble getting back to sleep after you woke up too early?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times per week

variable.name: QUALSLP
variable.description: Typical night's sleep
variable.comment: Overall, was your typical night's sleep during the past 4 weeks:

variable.name: HRSSLP
variable.description: How many hours of sleep
variable.comment: About how many hours of sleep did you get on a typical night during the past 4 weeks?

variable.name: FULLPEP
variable.description: Did you feel full of pep
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel full of pep?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: NERVOUS
variable.description: Have you been a very nervous person
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you been a very nervous person?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: DWNDUMPS
variable.description: Felt down in the dumps
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer you up?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: CALM
variable.description: Felt calm and peaceful
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you felt calm and peaceful?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: ENERGY
variable.description: Did you have a lot of energy
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you have a lot of energy?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: FELTBLUE
variable.description: Felt downhearted and blue
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you felt downhearted and blue?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: WORNOUT
variable.description: Did you feel worn out
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel wornout?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: HAPPY
variable.description: Have you been happy
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Have you been happy?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: TIRED
variable.description: Did you feel tired
variable.comment: These questions ask about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel tired?
variable.value: A good bit of the time

variable.name: ANXIOUS
variable.description: Feeling nervous, anxious, on edge
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Feeling nervous, anxious, on edge, or worrying a lot about different things

variable.name: RESTLSIT
variable.description: Feeling restless so hard to sit still
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Feeling restless so that it is hard to sit still

variable.name: TIREEASY
variable.description: Getting tired very easily
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Getting tired very easily

variable.name: MSCLACHE
variable.description: Muscle tension aches or soreness
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Muscle tension aches or soreness

variable.name: STAYSLP
variable.description: Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep

variable.name: NOCONCEN
variable.description: Trouble concentrating on things, reading
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading a book or watching TV

variable.name: ANNOYED
variable.description: Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Becoming easily annoyed or irritable

variable.name: PANIC
variable.description: Having an anxiety attack -- feel fear or panic
variable.comment: During the last 4 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Having an anxiety attack - suddenly feeling fear or panic

variable.name: BODPAIN
variable.description: How much bodily pain
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, how much bodily pain have you had?

variable.name: PAININT
variable.description: How much did pain interfere with your normal work
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (both outside your home and at home)?

variable.name: FELTDEP
variable.description: You felt depressed
variable.comment: These questions ask about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You felt depressed (blue or down)
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)

variable.name: RESTSLP
variable.description: Your sleep was restless
variable.comment: These questions ask about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. Your sleep was restless
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)

variable.name: ENJLIF
variable.description: You enjoyed life
variable.comment: These questions ask about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You enjoyed life
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)

variable.name: CRYSPELL
variable.description: You had crying spells
variable.comment: These questions ask about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You had crying spells
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)

variable.name: FELTSAD
variable.description: You felt sad
variable.comment: These questions ask about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You felt sad
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)

variable.name: PEOPDIS
variable.description: You felt people disliked you
variable.comment: These questions ask about your feelings during the past week. For each of the statements, please indicate the choice that tells how often you felt that way. You felt that people disliked you
variable.value: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)

variable.name: SAD2WK
variable.description: Felt sad for two weeks or more
variable.comment: In the past year, have you had 2 weeks or more during which you felt sad, blue, or depressed, or lost pleasure in things that you usually cared about or enjoyed?

variable.name: SAD2YRS
variable.description: Felt sad for two or more years
variable.comment: Have you had 2 years or more in your life when you felt depressed or sad on most days, even if you felt okay sometimes?

variable.name: SADMUCH
variable.description: Felt sad much of past year
variable.comment: Have you felt depressed or sad much of the time in the past year? Sub-question of F155 V1 Q124 'Felt sad for two or more years'

variable.name: NOEXPANDHORIZ
variable.description: Not interested in activities that will expand my horizons
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I am not interested in activities that will expand my horizons.

variable.name: NEWEXPERIENCE
variable.description: Important to have new experiences
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I think it is important to have new experiences that challenge how you think about yourself and the world.

variable.name: NOTIMPROVPERS
variable.description: Haven't improved much as a person
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: When I think about it, I haven't realy improved much as a person over the years.

variable.name: DEVELOPEDPERS
variable.description: Have developed a lot as a person
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I have the sense that I have developed a lot as a person over time.

variable.name: LIFEPROCESS
variable.description: Life has been a continuous process of learning, changing, and growth
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: For me, life has been a continuous process of learning, changing, and growth.

variable.name: GAVEUPIMPROVE
variable.description: Gave up trying to make big improvements in my life
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I gave up trying to make improvements or changes in my life a long time ago.

variable.name: NOENJOYNEW
variable.description: I do not enjoy new situations
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I do not enjoy being in new situations that require me to change my old familiar ways of doing things.

variable.name: LIVE1DAY
variable.description: I live life one day at a time
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I live life one day at a time and don't really think about the future.

variable.name: SENSEPURPOSE
variable.description: I have a sense of direction and purpose in life
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I have a sense of direction and purpose in life.

variable.name: NOSENSEACCOMP
variable.description: Don't have good sense of what trying to accomplish in life
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I don't have a good sense of what it is I'm trying to accomplish in life.

variable.name: TRIVIALACTS
variable.description: Daily activities often seem trivial and unimportant
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: My daily activities often seem trivial and unimportant to me.

variable.name: PLANFUTURE
variable.description: Enjoy making plans for the future
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I enjoy making plans for the future and working to make them a reality.

variable.name: CARRYOUTPLANS
variable.description: I am an active person in carrying out plans
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I am an active person in carrying out the plans I set for myself.

variable.name: NOTAIMLESS
variable.description: I am not wandering aimlessly through life
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: Some people wander aimlessly through life, but I am not one of them.

variable.name: DONEITALL
variable.description: Done all there is to do in this life
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I sometimes feel as if I've done all there is to do in this life.

variable.name: FELTPEACEFUL
variable.description: I felt peaceful
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I felt peaceful.

variable.name: LIVEREASON
variable.description: I had a reason for living
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I had a reason for living.

variable.name: LIFEPRODUCTIVE
variable.description: My life has been productive
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: My life has been productive.

variable.name: NOPEACEOFMIND
variable.description: I had trouble feeling peace of mind
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I had trouble feeling peace of mind.

variable.name: FELTPURPOSE
variable.description: I felt a sense of purpose in my life
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I felt a sense of purpose in my life.

variable.name: COMFORTMYSELF
variable.description: Able to reach down deep into myself for comfort
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I was able to reach down deep into myself for comfort.

variable.name: HARMONYWITHIN
variable.description: Felt sense of harmony
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I felt a sense of harmony within myself.

variable.name: LACKPURPOSE
variable.description: My life lacked meaning and purpose
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: My life lacked meaning and purpose.

variable.name: FAITHCOMFORT
variable.description: I found comfort in my faith
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I found comfort in my faith or spiritual beliefs.

variable.name: FAITHSTRENGTH
variable.description: I found strength in my faith
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I found strength in my faith or spiritual beliefs.

variable.name: FUTUREHOPE
variable.description: I am always hopeful about my future
variable.comment: The following are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle for each line. How true have the following been for you in this past week: I am always hopeful about my future.

variable.name: LIFEIDEAL
variable.description: My life is close to my ideal
variable.comment: The last questions are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle on each line. Mark the answer that best corresponds to how much you agree with each statement: In most ways my life is close to my ideal.

variable.name: LIFEEXCEL
variable.description: The conditions of my life are excellent
variable.comment: The last questions are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle on each line. Mark the answer that best corresponds to how much you agree with each statement: The conditions of my life are excellent.

variable.name: LIFESATISFIED
variable.description: I am satisfied with my life
variable.comment: The last questions are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle on each line. Mark the answer that best corresponds to how much you agree with each statement: I am statisfied with my life.

variable.name: LIFEIMPORTANT
variable.description: I have gotten the important things I want in life
variable.comment: The last questions are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle on each line. Mark the answer that best corresponds to how much you agree with each statement: So far I have gotten the important things I want in life.

variable.name: LIFENOCHANGE
variable.description: If I could live life over, I would change almost nothing
variable.comment: The last questions are about emotions you may have been feeling. Please mark one circle on each line. Mark the answer that best corresponds to how much you agree with each statement: If I could live my life over, I would change almost nothing.

variable.name: ACTDLY
variable.description: Activities of Daily Living Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 22-25. Source: WHI BAC. Four items describing basic activities (whether can eat, dress, get in and out of bed, and take a bath) each of which has three possible values (1=without help, 2=some help, 3=completely unable) are summed. A lower score indicates greater ability to cope with daily living activities. Missing if any of the four items are missing.

variable.name: EMOWELL
variable.description: Emotional Well-being
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 99, 100, 101, 103, and 105. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on emotional well-being. EMOWELL ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: ENERFAT
variable.description: Energy/Fatigue
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 98, 102, 104, and 106. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on energy/fatigue. ENERFAT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PHYSFUN
variable.description: Physical functioning construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 10-19. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on physical functioning. PHYSFUN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: SOCSUPP
variable.description: Social Support Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 38-46. Source: Medical Outcomes Study. Sum of nine components coded from 1=none of the time to 5=all of the time. The summary score ranges from 9 to 45 where a higher score indicates more social support.

variable.name: LFEVENT1
variable.description: Life Event Construct #1 (0,1 scoring)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 49-59. Source: WHI BAC; based on measures used in the Alameda County Study and BHAT. The eleven items are recoded, setting original responses from 1-3 equal to 1, and then summed. The construct has a range from 0 to 11 with a higher score indicating a greater number of life events.

variable.name: LFEVENT2
variable.description: Life Event Construct #2 (0-3 scoring)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 49-59. Source: WHI BAC; based on measures used in the Alameda County Study and BHAT. This construct is a sum of the eleven items that are coded from 0-3 resulting in a range from 0 to 33 with a higher score indicating a greater number of life events.

variable.name: F155SYMPTOM
variable.description: Symptom Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 60-75. Source: PEPI, national and other surveys. Average of 16 items measuring occurrence and severity of symptoms. The summary score ranges from 0 to 3 where a higher score indicates more numerous and/or more severe symptoms. This variable is not the same as the SYMPTOM variable constructed from 34 items collected on Form 37/38.

variable.name: SLPDSTRB
variable.description: Sleep Disturbance Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 92-96. Sum of five components. Questions 92-95 range from 1-5 and are recoded to a 0-4 scale. Question 96 is recoded and reverse coded resulting in a range from 0-4 before summing. The summary score ranges from 0 to 20 where a higher score indicates greater sleep disturbance.

variable.name: PAIN
variable.description: Pain Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 115 and 116. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on pain. PAIN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PSHTDEP
variable.description: Shortened CES-D/DIS Screening Instrument
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 117-124. Source: Center for Epidemiological Studies; depression scale (CES-D, short form). PSHTDEP ranges from 0 to 1 with a higher score indicating a greater likelihood of depression. Cutoff values of .06 and .009 have been used to indicate depression.

variable.name: WALKEXP
variable.description: MET-hours per week from walking
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, and 20.2. Expenditure of energy from physical activity from walking in kcal/week/kg (MET-hours per week).

variable.name: AVWKEXP
variable.description: Energy expend from average walking (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, and 20.2. Energy expenditure from average walking (2-3 mph) in MET-hours per week. If question 20.2 (speed of walking) was marked as 'don't know' or was missing, the speed was assumed to be 2-3 mph.

variable.name: FFWKEXP
variable.description: Energy expend from walking fairly fast (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, and 20.2. Energy expenditure form walking fairly fast (3-4 mph) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: VFWKEXP
variable.description: Energy expend from walking very fast (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, and 20.2. Energy expenditure from walking very fast (> 4 mph) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: MILDEXP
variable.description: Energy expenditure from mild exercise (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 21.3 and 21.4. Energy expenditure from mild exercise (for example, slow dancing, bowling, golf) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: TEPIWK
variable.description: Episodes recreational phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 21.1, and 21.3. Total number of episodes per week of recreational physical activity (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: TMINWK
variable.description: Minutes of recreational phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, 21.1, 21.2, 21.3, and 21.4. Total minutes per week of recreational physical activity (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: MSEPIWK
variable.description: Episodes moderate to strenuous phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20.2, and 21.1. Episodes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: MSMINWK
variable.description: Minutes of moderate to strenuous activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, 20.2, 21.1 and 21.2. Minutes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: LEPITOT
variable.description: Episodes recreational phys activity per week >= 20 Min
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, 21.1, 21.2, 21.3 and 21.4. Episodes per week of recreational physical activity of >=20 minutes duration (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: XLMSEPI
variable.description: Episodes moderate to strenuous activity >= 20 min/week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 20, 20.1, 20.2, 21.1 and 21.2. Episodes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity of >=20 minutes duration (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: LMSEPI
variable.description: Episodes moderate to strenuous activity >=20 min/week (categorical)
variable.comment: Categorical variable of episodes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity of >= 20 minutes duration (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity). Computed from XLMSEPI and TEPIWK.

variable.name: PSSSHT
variable.description: Perceived Stress Scale Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 82-85. Source: Four-item version of the Perceived Stress Scale (Cohen 1983). After reverse coding the responses to questions 83 and 84, the responses to all four items are summed. The scale ranges from 0 to 16, where a higher score indicates more perceived stress.

variable.name: PGROWTH1
variable.description: Personal Growth Construct (3-Item Scale)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 126, 129 and 130. Source: Scales of Psychological Well-Being (Ryff, 1989; Ryff & Keyes, 1995). Three-item scale for assessing personal growth. After reverse coding the response to question 130, the responses to the three items are summed. The score ranges from 0 to 12, where a higher score indicates a higher sense of continued development and sense of self growing and expanding.

variable.name: PURPOSE1
variable.description: Purpose in Life Constrct (3-Item Scale)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 132, 138 and 139. Source: Scales of Psychological Well-Being (Ryff, 1989; Ryff & Keyes, 1995). Three-item scale for assessing a sense of purpose in life. After reverse coding the responses to questions 132 and 139, the responses to the three items are summed. The score ranges from 0 to 12, where a higher score indicates a higher sense of purpose in life.

variable.name: SWLS
variable.description: Satisfaction with Life Construct
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 151-155. Source: The Satisfaction with Life Scale (Diener, 1985). Five-item scale for assessing degree of satisfaction with life. The responses to the five items are summed. The score ranges from 5 to 35, where a higher score indicates a higher degree of satisfaction with life.

variable.name: PGROWTH2
variable.description: Personal Growth Construct (7-Item Scale)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 125-131. Source: Scales of Psychological Well-Being (Ryff, 1989; Ryff & Keyes, 1995). Seven-item scale for assessing personal growth. After reverse coding the response to questions 125, 127, 130 and 131, the responses to the seven items are summed. The score ranges from 0 to 28, where a higher score indicates a higher sense of continued development and sense of self growing and expanding.

variable.name: PURPOSE2
variable.description: Purpose in Life Constrct (7-Item Scale)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 132-136, 138 and 139. Source: Scales of Psychological Well-Being (Ryff, 1989; Ryff & Keyes, 1995). Seven-item scale for assessing a sense of purpose in life. After reverse coding the responses to questions 132, 134, 135 and 139, the responses to the seven items are summed. The score ranges from 0 to 28, where a higher score indicates a higher sense of purpose in life.

variable.name: BRS
variable.description: Brief Resilience Scale
variable.comment: Computed from Form 155, questions 86-88. Source: The Brief Resilience Scale: Assessing the Ability to Bounce Back (Smith et al, 2008). Question 88 is reverse coded, and then the responses to each of the questions is collapsed from six to five categories as follows: strongly disagree => strongly disagree (1), disagree somewhat => disagree (2), disagree slightly or agree slightly => neutral (3), agree somewhat => agree (4), agree strongly => strongly agree (5). The score is then calculated by taking the average of these three values.
